column2: "What do you do that helps the earth?" Rain answered
column3: "I give the earth water so that the trees and plants can grow well. I give water for animals to drink." Rain asked Wind
column4: "What do you do that helps the earth?" Wind answered
column5: "I sweep the earth clean. I scatter the rain over the whole earth." Wind asked Sun
column6: "What do you do that helps the earth?" Sun answered
column7: "I give the earth light and warmth
column8: so that animals and plants can live." Sun
column10: Rain and Wind listened carefully to each other. Then Sun said
column11: "It is true that each of us helps the earth in our own special way." "Yes"
column13: "Not one of us is better than the others." "We can work together
column14: said Rain. Wind said, Then let us share the days." They all agreed. And that is why you sometimes see the moon when the sun is shining. And sometimes you feel the wind when it is raining. Sun
column16: Rain and Wind work very well together.
